PB.title: Pedestrian or Bicyclist
PB.description: The participants listed and/or first harmful event indicate both pedestrian and bicyclist participants for this crash. Which crash typing method do you prefer?

items.title: Intersection
items.description: The crash occurred within the intersection proper or within the crosswalk area. Note: Driveways controlled by signals or signs should be coded as Intersections. Uncontrolled driveways should be coded as Non-Intersection Locations.

items.title: Intersection-Related
items.description: The crash occurred outside the intersection crosswalk area but within 15 m (50 ft) of the intersection.

items.title: Non-Intersection Location
items.description: The crash occured on or along the roadway and more than 15 m (50 ft) away from an intersection.

items.title: Non-Roadway Location
items.description: The crash occurred off the roadway, including parking lots, driveways, private roads, yards, alleys, and other open areas. Note: Crashes occurring on paved shoulders, sidewalks, or driveway crossings are considered to be "roadway" crashes and should not be placed in the Non-Roadway classification.

items.title: Unknown/Insufficient Information
items.description: There is insufficient information to determine where the crash occurred.

P-2.title: Unusual Circumstances
P-2.description: The crash was the result of which of the following unusual circumstances:

items.title: Assault with Vehicle
items.description: The driver intentionally struck the pedestrian with the vehicle.

items.title: Dispute-Related
items.description: The pedestrian was struck by a vehicle during a domestic altercation or other dispute.

items.title: Pedestrian on Vehicle
items.description: The pedestrian was sitting on, leaning against, or clinging to a vehicle which began to move or was moving.

items.title: Vehicle-Vehicle/Object
items.description: The pedestrian was struck as a result of a prior vehicle-into-vehicle or vehicle-into-object crash.

items.title: Motor Vehicle Loss of Control
items.description: Vehicle lost control due to mechanical failure, surface conditions, driver error or impairment.

items.title: Pedestrian Loss of Control
items.description: The pedestrian stumbled, fell, or rolled into path of vehicle due to surface conditions, impairment or other mishap.

items.title: Other Unusual Circumstances
items.description: The crash involved other unusual circumstances, such as a pedestrian being struck by falling cargo or a loose wheel.

items.title: None of the Above
items.description: The crash did not involve any of the unusual circumstances described.

P-1A.title: Pedestrian Position - Intersection Or Intersection-Related
P-1A.description: What was the position of the pedestrian when struck?

items.title: Within a crosswalk, marked or unmarked
On a roadway, in a travel lane
On a roadway, in a paved shoulder, bike lane, or parking lane
On a sidewalk, shared use path, or driveway crossing

P-1B.title: Pedestrian Position - Non-Intersection
P-1B.description: What was the position of the pedestrian when struck?

items.title: Within a crosswalk, marked or unmarked
On a roadway, in a travel lane
On a roadway, in a paved shoulder, bike lane, or parking lane
On a sidewalk, multi-use path, or driveway crossing

P-1C.title: Pedestrian Position - Non-Roadway
P-1C.description: What was the position of the pedestrian when struck?

items.title: Other non-roadway areas  ( parking lot, non-right-of-way sidewalk or multi-use path, yard, open areas, etc.)

P-3.title: Unusual Vehicle Type or Action
P-3.description: The crash involved which of the following vehicle types or vehicle actions:

items.title: Backing Vehicle
items.description: The pedestrian was struck by a vehicle that was backing with a driver at the controls.

items.title: Driverless Vehicle
items.description: The pedestrian was struck by a vehicle that was moving without a driver at the controls, or that was set in motion by the actions of a child.

items.title: Disabled Vehicle-Related
items.description: The pedestrian was struck while near or next to a disabled vehicle (including a vehicle that had been in a crash) or while walking to or from a disabled vehicle. Note: Crashes involving pedestrians standing near tow trucks responding to the disabled vehicle are also included in this crash type.

items.title: Emergency Vehicle-Related
items.description: The pedestrian was struck while near an active emergency vehicle, by an active emergency vehicle, or by a vehicle being pursued.

items.title: Play Vehicle
items.description: The pedestrian was struck while riding a play vehicle that was not a bicycle (e.g., skates, scooter, wagon, sled, etc.)

items.title: None of the Above
items.description: The crash did not involve any of the unusual vehicle types or vehicle actions described.

P-3A.title: Backing Vehicle
P-3A.description: Where did the backing vehicle strike the pedestrian?

items.title: At the intersection of a driveway and sidewalk/walkway

P-3B.title: Backing Vehicle - Non-Roadway
P-3B.description: Where did the backing vehicle strike the pedestrian?

P-4.title: Unusual Pedestrian Action
P-4.description: The pedestrian was struck while performing which of the following actions:

items.title: Playing, Working, or Lying in Roadway
items.description: Playing, working, or lying in the roadway.

items.title: Entering/Exiting Parked Vehicle
items.description: The pedestrian was in the process of getting into or out of a stopped or parked vehicle. Note: Does not include crashes involving pedestrian crossing or other movements that occurred after the pedestrian exited the vehicle.

items.title: Mailbox-Related
items.description: Going to or from or standing at a mailbox or newspaper box.

items.title: Commercial Bus-Related
items.description: Crossing in front of a commercial bus stopped at a marked bus stop.

items.title: School Bus-Related
items.description: Going to or from or waiting at a school bus or school bus stop.

items.title: Ice-Cream/Vendor Truck-Related
items.description: Going to or from an ice-cream truck or other type of vehicle vending from the curb or roadside.

items.title: None of the Above
items.description: The pedestrian was not performing any of the unusual actions described.

P-4A.title: Working/Playing/Lying in Roadway
P-4A.description: Which of the following was the pedestrian doing when struck?

items.title: Working in Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was working in the roadway when struck.

items.title: Playing in Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was playing in the roadway when struck.

items.title: Lying in Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was lying in the roadway when struck.

P-5.title: Non-Roadway Crash
P-5.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Parking Lot
items.description: The motor vehicle struck a pedestrian in a parking lot.

items.title: Other Circumstances
items.description: There were other or unknown circumstances surrounding the crash.

P-6.title: Typical Pedestrian Action - Intersection
P-6.description: Which of the following best describes the pedestrian action at the time of the crash?

items.title: Waiting to Cross
items.description: The pedestrian was standing near the curb or roadway edge and waiting to cross the roadway.

items.title: Crossing the Roadway or In the Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was crossing the roadway or in the roadway.

items.title: Walking Along Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was walking along the roadway on the edge of a travel lane, on a paved or unpaved shoulder, grassy right-of-way or sidewalk.

items.title: Crossing a Driveway
items.description: The pedestrian was crossing a driveway intersection on a sidewalk crossing, shared use path, shoulder, or edge of the travel lane.

items.title: Unknown
items.description: The actions of the pedestrian at the time of the crash cannot be determined.

items.title: There is insufficient information to determine if the vehicle was turning at the time of the crash.

P-6B.title: Crossing/In Roadway - Intersection
P-6B.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Multiple Threat
items.description: The pedestrian entered the traffic lane in front of stopped or slowing traffic and was struck by a vehicle traveling in the same direction as the stopped or slowing traffic.

items.title: Turn/Merge
items.description: The pedestrian was struck by a vehicle preparing to turn or merge, actually turning or merging, or just completing a turn or merge maneuver.

items.title: Trapped
items.description: The pedestrian was struck while crossing at a signalized intersection when the light changed and traffic started moving.

items.title: Dash
items.description: The pedestrian ran into the roadway and was struck by a vehicle whose view of the pedestrian was not obstructed.

items.title: Dart-Out
items.description: The pedestrian walked or ran into the roadway and was struck by a motorist whose view of the pedestrian was blocked until an instant before impact.

items.title: None of The Above
items.description: The crash does not conform to any of the situations described.

P-6B1.title: Failure To Yield - Intersection
P-6B1.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Pedestrian Failed to Yield
items.description: The pedestrian failed to yield to the motorist.

items.title: Motorist Failed to Yield
items.description: The motorist failed to yield to the pedestrian.

items.title: Other/Unknown
items.description: The crash does not conform to either of the actions described or it cannot be determined who failed to yield.

P-6B1A.title: Pedestrian Failure To Yield - Intersection
P-6B1A.description: Which of the following best describes the pedestrian action?

items.title: The pedestrian walked into (i.e., struck) the vehicle.
The pedestrian misjudged the gap available for crossing the roadway.
The pedestrian stepped into the travel lane and was instantaneously struck.
The crash does not conform to any of the circumstances described.

P-6B2.title: Turn/Merge - Intersection
P-6B2.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Right Turn - Parallel Paths
items.description: The motorist was initially traveling on a parallel path with the pedestrian before making a right turn and striking the individual.

items.title: Right Turn - Perpendicular Paths
items.description: The motorist was initially traveling on a crossing path with the pedestrian before making a right turn and striking the individual.

items.title: Left Turn - Parallel Paths
items.description: The motorist was initially traveling on a parallel path with the pedestrian before making a left turn and striking the individual.

items.title: Left Turn - Perpendicular Paths
items.description: The motorist was initially traveling on a crossing path with the pedestrian before making a left turn and striking the individual.

items.title: Turn/Merge - Other/Unknown
items.description: Either the approach paths or turn direction are unknown or do not fit with any of the described circumstances.

P-6B2A.title: Right Turn On Red - Parallel Paths
P-6B2A.description: Was the motorist making a right turn on red?

P-6B3A.title: Right Turn On Red - Perpendicular Paths
P-6B3A.description: Was the motorist making a right turn on red?

P-6C.title: Other Action - Intersection
P-6C.description: Which of the following circumstances apply?

items.title: Standing in Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was standing in the roadway prior to the crash.

items.title: Walking in Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was walking in the roadway prior to the crash.

items.title: Walking/running with traffic and was struck from behind.
Walking/running with traffic and was struck from the front.
Walking/running against traffic and was struck from behind.
Walking/running against traffic and was struck from the front.
There is insufficient information to determine either the position or direction of the pedestrian at the time of the crash.

P-7.title: Typical Pedestrian Action - Non-Intersection
P-7.description: Which of the following best describes the pedestrian action at the time of the crash?

items.title: Walking Along Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was walking along the roadway on the edge of a travel lane, on a paved or unpaved shoulder, grassy right-of-way, or sidewalk.

items.title: Waiting to Cross
items.description: The pedestrian was standing near the curb or roadway edge and waiting to cross the roadway.

items.title: Crossing an Expressway
items.description: The pedestrian was crossing a limited access expressway or expressway ramp.

items.title: Crossing the Roadway or In the Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was crossing or in a roadway that is not an expressway.

items.title: Crossing a Driveway
items.description: The pedestrian was crossing a driveway on a sidewalk crossing, shared use path, shoulder, or edge of the travel lane.

items.title: Unknown
items.description: The actions of the pedestrian at the time of the crash cannot be determined.

items.title: Walking/running with traffic and was struck from behind.
Walking/running with traffic and was struck from the front.
Walking/running against traffic and was struck from behind.
Walking/running against traffic and was struck from the front.
There is insufficient information to determine either the position or direction of the pedestrian at the time of the crash.
There is insufficient information to determine if the vehicle was turning at the time of the crash.

P-7C.title: Crossing/In Roadway - Non-Intersection
P-7C.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Multiple Threat
items.description: The pedestrian entered the traffic lane in front of stopped or slowing traffic and was struck by a vehicle traveling in the same direction as the stopped or slowing traffic.

items.title: Turn/Merge
items.description: The pedestrian was struck by a vehicle preparing to turn or merge, actually turning or merging, or just completing a turn or merge maneuver.

items.title: Trapped
items.description: The pedestrian was struck while crossing at a signalized midblock crossing when the light changed and traffic started moving.

items.title: Dash
items.description: The pedestrian ran into the roadway and was struck by a vehicle whose view of the pedestrian was not obstructed.

items.title: Dart-Out
items.description: The pedestrian walked or ran into the roadway and was struck by a motorist whose view of the pedestrian was blocked until an instant before impact.

items.title: None of The Above
items.description: The crash does not conform to any of the situations described.

P-7C1.title: Failure To Yield - Non-Intersection
P-7C1.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Pedestrian Failed to Yield
items.description: The pedestrian failed to yield to the motorist.

items.title: Motorist Failed to Yield
items.description: The motorist failed to yield to the pedestrian.

items.title: Other
items.description: The crash does not conform to either of the actions described or it cannot be determined who failed to yield.

P-7C1A.title: Pedestrian Failure To Yield - Non-Intersection
P-7C1A.description: Which of the following best describes the pedestrian action?

items.title: The pedestrian walked into (i.e., struck) the vehicle.
The pedestrian misjudged the gap available for crossing the roadway.
The pedestrian stepped into the travel lane and was instantaneously struck.
The crash does not conform to any of the circumstances described.

P-7C2.title: Turn/Merge - Non-Intersection
P-7C2.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Right Turn - Parallel Paths
items.description: The motorist was initially travelling on a parallel path with the pedestrian before making a right turn and striking the individual.

items.title: Right Turn - Perpendicular Paths
items.description: The motorist was initially travelling on a crossing path with the pedestrian before making a right turn and striking the individual.

items.title: Left Turn - Parallel Paths
items.description: The motorist was initially traveling on a parallel path with the pedestrian before making a left turn and striking the individual.

items.title: Left Turn - Perpendicular Paths
items.description: The motorist was initially traveling on a crossing path with the pedestrian before making a left turn and striking the individual.

items.title: Turn/Merge - Other/Unknown
items.description: Either the approach paths or motorist turn direction are unknown or do not fit with any of the described circumstances.

P-7D.title: Other Action - Non-Intersection
P-7D.description: Which of the following circumstances apply?

items.title: Standing in Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was standing in the roadway prior to the crash.

items.title: Walking in Roadway
items.description: The pedestrian was walking in the roadway prior to the crash.

items.title: Other - Non-Intersection
items.description: The actions of the pedestrian prior to the crash cannot be determined or it cannot be determined who failed to yield.

P-7E.title: Crossing A Driveway Intersection
P-7E.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Entering a Driveway or Alley
items.description: The motor vehicle was turning into a driveway or alley and struck the pedestrian on a sidewalk/walkway or driveway crossing.

items.title: Exiting a Driveway or Alley
items.description: The motor vehicle was exiting a driveway or alley and struck the pedestrian on a sidewalk/walkway or driveway crossing.

items.title: Other/Unknown Circumstances
items.description: The pedestrian was on a driveway intersection when struck but there were other or unknown circumstances surrounding the crash from those described .

P-LF.title: Pedestrian Movement
P-LF.description: Select the scenario that best illustrates the pedestrian's movement when struck.

items.title: 11a
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, approached from same direction as motorist

items.title: 11b
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, approached from opposite direction as motorist

items.title: 11c
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

items.title: 12a
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, approached from same direction as motorist

items.title: 12b
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, approached from opposite direction as motorist

items.title: 12c
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

P-LN.title: Pedestrian Movement
P-LN.description: Select the scenario that best illustrates the pedestrian's movement when struck.

items.title: 9a
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's left

items.title: 9b
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's right

items.title: 9c
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

items.title: 10a
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's left

items.title: 10b
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's right

items.title: 10c
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

P-Q1.title: Motorist Direction of Travel
P-Q1.description: Select the motorist's initial direction of travel (before any turns).

P-Q3A.title: Leg of Intersection
P-Q3A.description: Select the leg of the intersection where the crash occurred.

P-Q3B.title: Leg of Intersection
P-Q3B.description: Select the leg of the intersection where the crash occurred.

P-Q3C.title: Leg of Intersection
P-Q3C.description: Select the leg of the intersection where the crash occurred.

P-RF.title: Pedestrian Movement
P-RF.description: Select the scenario that best illustrates the pedestrian's movement when struck.

items.title: 7a
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, approached from same direction as motorist

items.title: 7b
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, approached from opposite direction as motorist

items.title: 7c
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

items.title: 8a
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, approached from same direction as motorist

items.title: 8b
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, approached from opposite direction as motorist

items.title: 8c
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

P-RN.title: Pedestrian Movement
P-RN.description: Select the scenario that best illustrates the pedestrian's movement when struck.

items.title: 5a
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's left

items.title: 5b
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's right

items.title: 5c
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

items.title: 6a
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's left

items.title: 6b
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's right

items.title: 6c
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

P-SF.title: Pedestrian Movement
P-SF.description: Select the scenario that best illustrates the pedestrian's movement when struck.

items.title: 3a
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's left

items.title: 3b
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's right

items.title: 3c
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

items.title: 4a
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's left

items.title: 4b
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's right

items.title: 4c
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

P-SN.title: Pedestrian Movement
P-SN.description: Select the scenario that best illustrates the pedestrian's movement when struck.

items.title: 1a
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's left

items.title: 1b
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's right

items.title: 1c
items.description: Pedestrian within crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

items.title: 2a
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's left

items.title: 2b
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, traveled from motorist's right

items.title: 2c
items.description: Pedestrian outside crosswalk area, approach direction unknown

items.title: Intersection
items.description: The crash occurred within the intersection proper or within the crosswalk area. Note: Unsignalized driveways are considered to be non-intersection locations.

items.title: Intersection-Related
items.description: The crash occurred outside the intersection proper or crosswalk area but was related to the presence of the intersection (e.g., the result of queuing traffic).

items.title: Non-Intersection Location
items.description: The crash occurred outside the intersection proper or crosswalk area and was not related to the presence of any intersection.

items.title: Non-Roadway Location
items.description: The crash occurred off the street network (e.g., parking lots, driveways, alleys, trails, and other open areas). Note: crashes occurring on paved shoulders, bike lanes, sidewalks, or driveway crossings are considered to be "roadway" crashes and should not be placed in the non-roadway classification.

items.title: Unknown/Insufficient Information
items.description: There is insufficient information to determine where the crash occurred.

B-2.title: Bicyclist Position
B-2.description: What was the initial position of the bicyclist?

items.title: On a roadway, in a shared travel lane
On a roadway, in a bicycle lane or on a paved shoulder
On a sidewalk, crosswalk, or driveway crossing
Other non-roadway  areas (parking lot, open areas, etc.)
Other (e.g., unpaved shoulder, worn path, etc.)

B-3.title: Bicyclist Direction of Travel
B-3.description: In what direction was the bicyclist initially traveling prior to being struck or prior to making any turns which caused the crash?

items.title: Not applicable (e.g., exiting a driveway, in a parking lot, or other non-roadway area)

B-4.title: Unusual/Specific Circumstances
B-4.description: Which of the following unusual or specific circumstances best describe the crash?

items.title: Bicycle Only
items.description: The crash involved a bicycle but no motor vehicle.

items.title: Intentional
items.description: The motorist or bicyclist intentionally caused the crash.

items.title: Play Vehicle-Related
items.description: The bicyclist was riding a child's vehicle such as a tricycle (not an adult tricycle), bicycle with training wheels, or "Big Wheel" type tricycle.

items.title: Unusual Circumstances
items.description: There were other unusual circumstances not defined above (e.g., bicyclist struck by falling cargo).

items.title: Backing Vehicle
items.description: The crash involved a motor vehicle that was backing and did not involve a play vehicle.

items.title: None of the Above
items.description: The crash does not conform to any of the specific or unusual circumstances described.

B-6.title: Initial Approach Paths
B-6.description: What were the initial approach paths for the bicyclist and motorist?

items.title: Crossing Paths - See Examples Below
items.description: The bicyclist and motorist were on intersecting paths prior to the crash and prior to any turns that caused the crash or turns to avoid the crash.

items.title: Parallel Paths - See Examples Below
items.description: The bicyclist and motorist were on parallel paths prior to the crash and prior to any turns that caused the crash or turns to avoid the crash. The two vehicles could have been heading in the same direction or opposing directions.

items.title: Unknown/Insufficient Information
items.description: There is insufficient information to determine the initial approach paths of the vehicles.

B-7.title: Crossing Paths - Intersection
B-7.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Turning Error
items.description: Either the bicyclist or motorist made a turning error which led them into the path of the other operator.

items.title: Loss of Control
items.description: Either the motorist or bicyclist clearly lost control and inadvertently moved into the path of the other operator.

items.title: Drive/Ride - Out/Through
items.description: Either the motorist drove or the bicyclist rode into the intersection or crosswalk area and into the path of the other operator without making a turning error or losing control of the vehicle prior to the crash.

items.title: Other Circumstances
items.description: The crash involved a bicyclist and motorist on initial crossing paths but does not conform to any of the circumstances described.

B-7A.title: Turning Error
B-7A.description: Which best describes the turning error made by either the motorist or bicyclist?

items.title: Motorist Left Turn
items.description: The motorist made a left turn, cut the corner and entered the opposing traffic lane.

items.title: Motorist Right Turn
items.description: The motorist made a right turn, swung too wide and entered the opposing traffic lane.

items.title: Bicyclist Left Turn
items.description: The bicyclist made a left turn, cut the corner and entered the opposing traffic lane.

items.title: Bicyclist Right Turn
items.description: The bicyclist made a right turn, swung too wide and entered the opposing traffic lane.

items.title: Bicyclist Other Turn
items.description: The bicyclist made another type of turning error which led them into the path of the motorist.

items.title: Motorist Other Turn
items.description: The motorist made another type of turning error which led them into the path of the bicyclist.

B-7B.title: Loss Of Control
B-7B.description: Who lost control and what was the cause?

items.subHeading: The bicyclist lost control due to:
items.title: mechanical problems
oversteering, improper braking, or speed too fast for conditions

items.subHeading: The motorist lost control due to:
items.title: mechanical problems
oversteering, improper braking, or speed too fast for conditions
surface conditions (sand, debris, potholes, ice, etc.)

B-7C.title: Sign-Controlled Intersection
B-7C.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Motorist Drive-Out
items.description: The motorist drove into the roadway or across a sidewalk/driveway crossing area and into the path of a bicyclist.

items.title: Bicyclist Ride-Out
items.description: The bicyclist was facing the sign or flashing signal and rode into the intersection and collided with the motorist after stopping or yielding.

items.title: Motorist Drive-Through
items.description: The motorist violated the sign or flashing signal and drove into the crosswalk area or intersection and collided with the bicyclist.

items.title: Bicyclist Ride-Through
items.description: The bicyclist violated the sign or flashing signal and rode into the intersection and collided with the motorist.

items.title: Multiple Threat
items.description: The bicyclist entered the roadway in front of standing or slowing traffic and was struck by another motorist whose view of the bicyclist was blocked.

items.title: Other / Unknown
items.description: The crash occurred at a sign-controlled intersection but does not conform to any of the circumstances described or the circumstances are unknown.

B-7D.title: Signal-Controlled Intersection
B-7D.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Motorist Drive-Out
items.description: The motorist was facing a red signal, stopped, and then drove into the crosswalk area or intersection and collided with the bicyclist.

items.title: Bicyclist Ride-Out
items.description: The bicyclist was facing the red signal, stopped, and then rode into the intersection and collided with the motorist.

items.title: Motorist Drive-Through
items.description: The motorist violated the signal and drove into the crosswalk area or intersection and collided with the bicyclist.

items.title: Bicyclist Ride-Through
items.description: The bicyclist violated the signal and rode into the intersection and collided with the motorist.

items.title: Bicyclist Failed to Clear
items.description: The bicyclist lawfully entered the intersection on green but did not clear the intersection before the signal changed to green for the cross-street traffic.

items.title: Other / Unknown
items.description: The crash occurred at a signal-controlled intersection but does not conform to any of the circumstances described or the circumstances are unknown.

B-7D1.title: Right Turn On Red - Crossing Paths
B-7D1.description: Was the motorist making a right turn on red?

B-7D2.title: Bicyclist Failed To Clear Intersection
B-7D2.description: Which of the following scenarios best describes the crash?

items.title: Trapped
items.description: The bicyclist was struck by a motorist whose view was not obstructed by standing or stopped traffic.

items.title: Multiple Threat
items.description: The bicyclist entered the intersection in front of standing or slowing traffic and was struck by a motorist whose view of the bicyclist was obstructed.

items.title: Unknown
items.description: It is unknown whether the bicyclist was struck by a motorist whose view was obstructed or circumstances do not conform to either of those described.

B-7E.title: Type Of Traffic Control
B-7E.description: What type of traffic control was present at the intersection?

items.title: Stop signs, yield signs, or flashing signals

B-8.title: Crossing Paths - Non-Intersection
B-8.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Bicyclist Ride-Out
items.description: The bicyclist rode into the roadway and into the path of a motor vehicle.

items.title: Motorist Drive-Out
items.description: The motorist drove into the roadway or across a sidewalk/driveway crossing area and into the path of a bicyclist.

items.title: Loss of Control
items.description: Either the motorist or bicyclist clearly lost control and inadvertently moved into the path of the other operator.

items.title: Turning Error
items.description: Either the bicyclist or motorist made a turning error which led them into the path of the other operator.

items.title: Multiple Threat
items.description: The bicyclist entered the roadway in front of standing or slowing traffic and was struck by another motorist whose view of the bicyclist was blocked.

items.title: Other Circumstances
items.description: The crash involved a bicyclist and motorist on initial crossing paths but does not conform to any of the circumstances described.

B-8A.title: Bicyclist Ride-Out - Non-Intersection
B-8A.description: From where did the bicyclist come?

B-8B.title: Motorist Drive-Out - Non-Intersection
B-8B.description: From where did the motorist come?

B-9.title: Parallel Paths
B-9.description: Which of the following best describes the circumstances of the crash?

items.title: Motorist Turned or Merged
items.description: The motorist turned, merged, or swerved into the path of the bicyclist.

items.title: Bicyclist Turned or Merged
items.description: The bicyclist turned or merged into the path of the motorist.

items.title: Motorist Overtaking
items.description: The motorist was overtaking the bicyclist. Note: Includes crashes where the bicyclist may have swerved into the path of the overtaking vehicle.

items.title: Bicyclist Overtaking
items.description: The bicyclist was overtaking the motorist. Note: Crashes involving parked vehicles are included.

items.title: Head-On
items.description: Either operator was going the wrong way, and the two parties collided head-on.

items.title: Loss of Control
items.description: Either the motorist or bicyclist clearly lost control and inadvertently moved into the path of the other operator.

items.title: Other / Unknown Circumstances
items.description: The crash involved a bicyclist and motorist on initial parallel paths but does not conform to any of the circumstances described or are unknown.

B-9A.title: Motorist Turn/Merge
B-9A.description: Which of the following scenarios best describes the maneuver of the motorist?

items.title: Left Turn - Same Direction
items.description: The motorist turned left in front of a bicyclist going in the same direction.

items.title: Left Turn - Opposite Direction
items.description: The motorist turned left in front of a bicyclist coming from the opposite direction.

items.title: Drive-In/Out - Parking
items.description: The motorist struck the bicyclist while exiting or entering on-street parking.

items.title: Right Turn - Same Direction
items.description: The motorist turned right in front of a bicyclist going in the same direction.

items.title: Right Turn - Opposite Direction
items.description: The motorist turned right in front of a bicyclist coming from the opposite direction.

items.title: Bus/Delivery Vehicle Pullover
items.description: The bicyclist was struck by a bus or delivery vehicle pulling into or away from the curb.

items.title: Other / Unknown
items.description: The motorists turning maneuver is other than those described or is unknown.

B-9A1.title: Motorist Right on Red - Same Direction
B-9A1.description: Was the motorist making a right turn on red?

B-9A2.title: Motorist Right on Red - Opposite Direction
B-9A2.description: Was the motorist making a right turn on red?

B-9B.title: Bicyclist Turn/Merge
B-9B.description: Which of the following scenarios best describes the maneuver of the bicyclist?

items.title: Left Turn - Same Direction
items.description: The bicyclist turned or merged left in front of a motorist going in the same direction.

items.title: Left Turn - Opposite Direction
items.description: The bicyclist turned or merged left in front of a motorist coming from the opposite direction.

items.title: Ride-Out
items.description: The bicyclist, initially on a sidewalk or other parallel path, rode into the roadway and into the path of a motor vehicle.

items.title: Right Turn - Same Direction
items.description: The bicyclist turned or merged right in front of a motorist going in the same direction.

items.title: Right Turn - Opposite Direction
items.description: The bicyclist turned or merged right in front of a motorist coming from the opposite direction.

B-9C.title: Motorist Overtaking
B-9C.description: Which of the following best describes the overtaking crash?

items.title: Undetected Bicyclist
items.description: The motorist failed to detect the bicyclist.

items.title: Misjudged Space
items.description: The motorist misjudged the width and distance required to pass the bicyclist.

items.title: Bicyclist Swerve
items.description: The bicyclist swerved or moved suddenly into the path of an overtaking vehicle.

items.title: Other/Unknown
items.description: The specific circumstances surrounding the overtaking maneuver do not conform to any of the situations described or are unknown.

B-9D.title: Bicyclist Overtaking
B-9D.description: Which of the following best describes the overtaking crash?

items.title: Passing on Right
items.description: The bicyclist struck a motor vehicle in the travel lane while passing on the right.

items.title: Passing on Left
items.description: The bicyclist struck a motor vehicle in the travel lane while passing on the left.

items.title: Parked Vehicle
items.description: The bicyclist struck a parked vehicle while passing.

items.title: Extended Door
items.description: The bicyclist struck an extended door on a parked vehicle while passing.

items.title: Other/Unknown
items.description: The specific circumstances surrounding the overtaking maneuver do not conform to any of the situations described or are unknown.

B-9E.title: Head-On
B-9E.description: Which operator was traveling in the wrong direction or in the wrong travel lane?
